questions.questionText: Vital signs
Delirium signs/symptoms (Select all that apply):

responseOptions.responseText: No delirium signs and symptoms present

questions.questionText: Level of Consciousness:

responseOptions.responseText: Alert/awake and responsive to verbal stimulation

questions.questionText: Recall ability (select all that apply):

responseOptions.responseText: That he/she is in a nursing home/rehab facility.

questions.questionText: Memory (Select all that apply):
Decision-Making Ability:
If any of the answers to questions 1-5 represent a change in the resident's prior cognitive status, describe here and notify provider as appropriate:
Does the resident have a neurological diagnosis or symptoms?
Does the resident present with any of the following symptoms? (Select all that apply).

responseOptions.responseText: Cognitive status change from baseline in memory, LOC, recall, or decision-making ability.
Flaccidity, muscle rigidity, tremors, paralysis, or paresthesia.
Fatigue related to extremity weakness, spasticity, and stressors.
Change in balance or gait pattern.

questions.questionText: Additional notes or comments related to the resident's neurological status:
Resident is currently receiving (select all that apply):

responseOptions.responseText: Has new orders for therapy services

questions.questionText: Prior to answering the question below, discuss resident status with nursing assistant and review nursing assistant documentation using the lookback link.
Based on review of nursing assistant ADL documentation, resident observation, and therapy interventions the resident's ADL self-performance has:

responseOptions.responseText: Improved in some areas/declined in others.

questions.questionText: Additional notes and comments related to resident's musculoskeletal status:
Does the resident have a cardiac diagnosis or symptoms?
Pulse rhythm:
On auscultation, were adventitious (abnormal) sounds identified?
If the answer to question 3 is yes, describe:
Does the resident have edema present?
If the answer to question 4 is yes, describe location and severity:
Does the resident present with any of the following symptoms? (Select all that apply).

responseOptions.responseText: Chest, neck, arm, or jaw pain.
Cramping or pain in the lower extremities.
Abnormal heart sounds or rhythm on auscultation.

questions.questionText: Additional notes and comments related to the resident's cardiovascular status:
Does the resident have a respiratory diagnosis or symptoms?
Right Upper Lobe (RUL) [Anterior and Posterior Auscultation]:
Right Lower Lobe (RLL) [Posterior Auscultation]:
Left Upper Lobe (LUL) [Anterior and Posterior Auscultation]:
Left Lower Lobe (LLL) [Posterior Auscultation]:
Lung sound notes (if adventitious/abnormal sounds identified, describe here):
Does the resident use a BiPap/CPAP?
Quality of Respiration (Select all that apply):

responseOptions.responseText: Unable to lay flat due to shortness of breath.

questions.questionText: Does the resident present with any of the following signs/symptoms? Select all that apply).

responseOptions.responseText: Dyspnea at rest or during activity.
Chest pain or pain on inspiration or expiration.
Sternal retraction or unequal chest expansion.
Cyanosis of lips, fingers, feet or nail beds.

questions.questionText: If cough present, describe characteristics including sputum amount and color, if appropriate:
What activity, if any, causes increased or decreased oxygen saturation level?
Does the resident have a tracheostomy?
If the resident has a tracheostomy, select all appropriate responses:
If the resident requires suctioning, how frequently is it required?
Does the resident require Oxygen therapy?
If yes, is the oxygen therapy continuous or prn?
Identify flow rate of oxygen therapy:
Additional notes or comments related to the resident's respiratory status:
Does the resident have a gastrointestinal diagnosis or symptoms?
Right Upper Quadrant (RUQ):
Right Lower Quadrant (RLQ):
Left Upper Quadrant (LUQ):
Left Lower Quadrant (LLQ):
Abdominal Observation:
Does the resident present with any of the following symptoms? (Select all that apply).

responseOptions.responseText: Abdominal pain, distention, epigastric distress or tenderness
Recent significant weight loss or gain.
Oral food intake routinely less than 50%.

questions.questionText: Does the resident have an ostomy?
Non-oral nutritional support (Select all that apply):
Additional notes and comments related to resident's gastrointestinal status:
Does the resident have a diagnosis or signs/symptoms related to a genitourinary condition?
Toilet use (Select all that apply):
Describe quality of urine (clear, cloudy, yellow, etc.)
Does the resident present with any of the following? (Select all that apply).

responseOptions.responseText: Urinary frequency, hesitancy, dysuria, or urgency.

questions.questionText: Does the resident have a catheter?
If catheter present, please document type of catheter and catheter/balloon sizes, as appropriate.
Additional notes or comments about resident's genitourinary status:
Is the resident receiving dialysis?
If the answer to question 1 is yes, what type of dialysis is the resident receiving?
Does the resident present with any of the following signs/symptoms (Select all that apply)

responseOptions.responseText: Nausea, Nausea, vomiting, bad breath, ammonia smell, or GI upset.
Pale, excessively dry or itchy skin.
Swelling of the face, feet, or eyes.

questions.questionText: Additional notes or comments related to resident's dialysis or renal status:
Does the resident have a diagnosis of diabetes, hypothyroidism, hyperthyroidism, or any other type of endocrine system disorder?
Does the resident present with any of the following signs/symptoms (Select all that apply)

responseOptions.responseText: Vision changes (i.e., blurred vision, black spots).
Changes in affect, mentation, short term memory, or delusions.
Thickened, dry skin or thin, brittle nails.
Decreased deep tendon responses, decreased sensation, decreased proprioception, or paresthesia.

questions.questionText: Additional notes or comments about the resident's endocrine status:
Does the resident have an active infection?
If the answer to question 1 is yes, what type of infection is present?
Does the resident present with any the following signs/symptoms? (Select all that apply)
Is the resident on isolation precautions?
If the answer to question 3 is "yes", what type of precautions are in place?
<b>If on isolation precautions, is the resident in single room isolation with all services provided in the room?<b>
Additional notes or comments related to the resident's infection status:
Does the resident have a vascular access device in place?
Type of vascular access device present:
If the answer to question 1a is "other", describe:
Date of insertion (if known):
Length of line (if applicable):
Description of site (Select all that apply).
Additional notes or comments related to the resident's IV status:
If appropriate, document any resident/responsible party education and teach-back provided. (Select all that apply).
Additional notes or comments related to education provided:
What interventions did you provide to the resident? (Select all that apply).

responseOptions.responseText: Provided respiratory treatments (i.e.m, aerosols, nebulizers) as ordered.
Notified responsible party about change in condition/new orders.
Ostomy care provided (colostomy, ileostomy, urostomy, nephrostomy).
Monitored for signs / symptoms of infection.
Maintained sodium and;//or fluid restrictions as ordered.
Encouraged resident to maintain correct positioning.
Inspected feet and provided foot care.
Monitored for signs of joint dislocation.
Monitored for myxedema signs and symptoms (i.e., hypothermia, bradycardia, hypoventilation, hypotension, palpitations,syncope).
Monitored for signs/symptoms of hypo- or hyperglycemia.
Monitored for therapeutic and nontherapeutic effects of antibiotics.
Monitored for signs / symptoms of sepsis.
Encouraged use of incentive spirometry, coughing, and deep breathing.
Monitored for signs/symptoms of primary or secondary infection.

questions.questionText: Do any of the evaluation findings reflect a change from current status?
If "Yes" was selected for question 2, document information about notification of responsible party and/or physician related to change:
Document any additional pertinent information obtained during your evaluation of the resident:
<b>Is the head of the bed elevated to prevent SOB while lying flat?<b>
Shortness of breath or trouble breathing with exertion (e.g., walking, bathing, transferring)
Shortness of breath or trouble breathing when sitting at rest
Shortness of breath or trouble breathing when lying flat
